title: Nutrients in an aquatic ecosystem SM2

content.question: The average growth rate of the phytoplankton population from 1971 to 1975 in the side of the lake treated with sucrose and phosphate is closest to which of the following?

choices.label: <math alttext="125 milligrams per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>125</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>⁢</mo><mfrac><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> per year

<math alttext="1,000 milligrams per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>⁢</mo><mfrac><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> per year

<math alttext="1,500 milligrams per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>500</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>⁢</mo><mfrac><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> per year

<math alttext="6,000 milligrams per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>⁢</mo><mfrac><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> per year

content.answer: <math alttext="1,500 milligrams per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>500</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>⁢</mo><mfrac><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> per year

skill.text: 5.A: Perform mathematical calculations, including: i. mathematical equations in the curriculum ii. means iii. rates iv. ratios v. percentages and percent changes
